post.author: 김승엽
post.content:
WINDOWS 2000 INHERITED PERMISSIONS | by Adesh Rampat

It's probably not a good idea for you to leave things the way they
are by default when you initiate sharing of a file or folder.

>> CLICK for the Full Tip...
http://www.searchWin2000.com/tip/1,289483,sid1_gci774626,00.html


=-=-=-=-=-=-=;답?=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
DISABLING WINDOWS 2000 DEFAULT SHARES | by Scott Yenor

Adesh Rampat's "Disabling Windows 2000 default shares" said to
disable the Server service. But if you want to disable the default
administrative shares, yet still have your own, you need to do it
this way, says searchWin2000 member Scott Yenor.
>> CLICK for the Full Tip...
http://searchwin2000.techtarget.com/tip/1,289483,sid1_gci760119,00.html


=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
COPYING AND MOVING ENCRYPTED FILES | by Chinari Subudhi

SearchWin2000 member Chinari Subudhi explains how to copy a file or
folder from an NTFS partition to another NTFS partition, to a FAT
partition, to a location on the same Win2k computer, or even to an
NT4 location.

>> CLICK for the Full Tip...
http://searchwin2000.techtarget.com/tip/1,289483,sid1_gci752077,00.html
post.title: Window2000 TIPS: Security TIPS
